edu.iastate.cs228.hw5

Class Graph<V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.iastate.cs228.hw5.Graph<V>

  • public class Graph<V>
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Xiaoqiu Huang An undirected graph class implemented using a hash map whose keys are vertices of type V and whose values are sets of neighbors (HashSet of V). Neither parallel edges or self-loops are allowed. This class is complete and should not be modified

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Graph()
      Creates an empty graph

      void addEdge(V u, V v)
      Adds an undirected edge between vertices u and v adding new vertices they do not exist in the Graph already.

      Add a new vertex with no neighbors (if it does not yet exist)
      java.lang.Iterable<V> adjacentTo(V v)
      Returns an Iterable set of the neighbors of the given vertex
      int degree(V v)
      Return the degree of vertex
      boolean hasEdge(V u, V v)
      Test if (u, v) an edge in the graph

      Test if a vertex in the graph
      int numE()
      Return number of edges

      Return number of vertices

      Removes the given edge from the Graph

        v - - the data of the second vertex
        Throws:

        Returns:
